caption:
This image captures a dramatic and vast landscape during either dawn or dusk. The foreground shows rugged terrain, likely a forested area that has experienced logging or a natural disturbance, with broken tree trunks and scattered debris visible. There are no people or animals evident in this scene.

The middle ground of the photograph is dominated by a thick layer of mist or low clouds nestling in the valleys between rolling hills. This natural phenomenon adds a serene and somewhat mysterious quality to the landscape.

In the background, a series of mountains extends across the horizon. These are partially obscured by the atmospheric conditions, which add a sense of depth and vastness to the view.

The sky above is a spectacle in itself, featuring a complex pattern of clouds that are illuminated by the soft light of the sun, which is below the horizon line but casts a gentle glow. The cloud formations are dynamic, indicating windy conditions high up. The shades of blue and gray dominate the palette, punctuated by hints of warmer tones near the horizon, suggesting the time of day is close to sunset or sunrise.

This photo captures a moment of natural tranquility and illustrates the interaction of light, weather, and landscape in creating visual and atmospheric depth.
title: Clear- cut with slash in the timberland on vancouver island, british Columbia, canada.  Taken in the forest near port alberni, british Columbia.  From the environmental protection agencys project documerica collection, "in praise of forest".  For additional images see fiche #s 209, 210, 211, 212, and 213.  Entheos.  Summer, 1974.
